alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth; Guilford; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 4:35PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT FORSYTH...NORTHEASTERN DAVIDSON...NORTHWESTERN RANDOLPH AND WESTERN GUILFORD COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 435 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Enon, or near East Bend, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 35 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Winston-Salem, High Point, Thomasville, Kernersville, Clemmons, Bermuda Run, Huntsville, Lewisville, and Archdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
